headline: OpenAI’s New Sora Video Generator to Require Copyright Holders to Opt Out
summary: OpenAI is planning to release a new version of its Sora video generator that creates videos featuring copyright material unless copyright holders opt out of having their work appear, according to people familiar with the matter.  OpenAI began alerting talent agencies and studios about the forthcoming product and its opt-out process over the past week and plans to release the new version in the coming days, the people said.  The opt-out process for the new version of Sora means that movie studios and other intellectual property owners would have to explicitly ask OpenAI not to include their copyright material in videos the tool creates.

raw.headline: OpenAI’s New Sora Video Generator to Require Copyright Holders to Opt Out

The opt-out process for the new version of Sora means that movie studios and other intellectual property owners would have to explicitly ask OpenAI not to include their copyright material in videos the tool creates.

headline: Google to Pay $24.5 Million to End Trump Suit Over Jan. 6 Ban
summary: The settlement disclosed Monday ends Trump’s long-running legal challenge to the suspension.  The filing says $22 million will go toward construction of a new ballroom in the White House, a project near and dear to Trump.  Google declined to comment.

raw.headline: Google to Pay $24.5 Million to End Trump Suit Over Jan. 6 Ban
raw.summary: The settlement disclosed Monday ends Trump’s long-running legal challenge to the suspension.  The filing says $22 million will go toward construction of a new ballroom in the White House, a project near and dear to Trump.  Google declined to comment.

headline: Trump floats tariffs on furniture & movies, EA to go private
summary: Yahoo Finance's John Hyland tracks today's top-moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute, including President Trump's proposed tariffs on furniture imports and movies made outside of the US and Electronic Arts (EA) going private via a buyout valued at up to $55 billion. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Can Disney Keep Growth Momentum Despite Cruise Delays And Travel Worries?
summary: Walt Disney Co. (NYSE: DIS) is poised for a stronger-than-expected fourth quarter as a combination of rising theme park attendance, per-capita spending, and strategic pricing moves across its parks and streaming services positions the company to outperform revenue and profit expectations. While box office softness weighs on content sales, growth in Disney+ subscriptions, new cruise offerings, and cross-selling initiatives are set to underpin overall margins and drive momentum into 2026. Goldman

headline: How would Trump's foreign-made film tariffs actually work?
summary: President Trump says he will impose a 100% tariff on foreign films, adding that "our movie-making business has been stolen." Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Allie Canal joins Market Catalysts host Julie Hyman to go over the details so far. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.
